alert.note: Alert for Coastal Bay; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; South Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued July 23 at 3:15PM EDT until July 25 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Walton, Bay, Gulf, and Franklin County Beaches. * WHEN...Through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...On Sunday afternoon, the buoy about 100 miles south of Panama City Beach was observing 4-foot southwesterly wave heights, with a dominant wave period of 6 seconds. These waves will spread toward the Emerald and Forgotten Coasts, bringing a high risk of rip currents through Monday.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Bay; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; South Walton
